DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy Myo-Inositol Creatine Metabolite Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Value for the ratio of brain metabolites Myo-inositol and Creatine as a measure of function in an individual undergoing an MR imaging scan. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy Myo-Inositol Creatine Ratio
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Detection and measurement of the resonant spectra of molecular species in a tissue or sample.__A natural sugar found in cell membrane phospholipids, plasma lipoproteins, and (as the phosphate form) in the nucleus with potential chemopreventive properties. As one of a number of intracellular phosphate compounds, inositol is involved in cell signaling and may stimulate tumor cell differentiation. (NCI04)_An endogenous amino acid derivative produced by vertebrate animals and occurring primarily in muscle cells.  Creatine is important for energy storage; it is phosphorylated to creatine phosphate, which serves as a phosphate donor in the conversion of ADP to ATP and supplies energy necessary for muscle contraction.  Dietary supplementation with creatine may improve muscle wasting associated with cancer and other chronic diseases._The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Detection and measurement of the resonant spectra of molecular species in a tissue or sample.

Concepts.definition: Detection and measurement of the resonant spectra of molecular species in a tissue or sample.

Property.preferredDefinition: A natural sugar found in cell membrane phospholipids, plasma lipoproteins, and (as the phosphate form) in the nucleus with potential chemopreventive properties. As one of a number of intracellular phosphate compounds, inositol is involved in cell signaling and may stimulate tumor cell differentiation. (NCI04):An endogenous amino acid derivative produced by vertebrate animals and occurring primarily in muscle cells.  Creatine is important for energy storage; it is phosphorylated to creatine phosphate, which serves as a phosphate donor in the conversion of ADP to ATP and supplies energy necessary for muscle contraction.  Dietary supplementation with creatine may improve muscle wasting associated with cancer and other chronic diseases.:The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE)

Concepts.definition: A natural sugar found in cell membrane phospholipids, plasma lipoproteins, and (as the phosphate form) in the nucleus with potential chemopreventive properties. As one of a number of intracellular phosphate compounds, inositol is involved in cell signaling and may stimulate tumor cell differentiation. (NCI04)

An endogenous amino acid derivative produced by vertebrate animals and occurring primarily in muscle cells.  Creatine is important for energy storage; it is phosphorylated to creatine phosphate, which serves as a phosphate donor in the conversion of ADP to ATP and supplies energy necessary for muscle contraction.  Dietary supplementation with creatine may improve muscle wasting associated with cancer and other chronic diseases.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
